decks.notes: This Jund deck focuses on aggressive plays using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf, along with disruption from cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. Removal spells such as Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt help control the board while cards like Liliana of the Veil and Kolaghan's Command provide additional value. The deck aims to apply pressure early on while disrupting the opponent's game plan, utilizing a combination of creatures, removal, and discard spells to dominate the game.

The main focus of this Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly deal damage to the opponent while efficiently removing any threats they may have. Utilizing low-cost, high-value cards such as Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, this deck aims to apply pressure from the get-go. With a combination of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Searing Blaze, along with efficient creatures, this deck looks to overwhelm opponents and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Human creatures that benefit from each other's presence, such as Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Aether Vial helps to cheat out creatures and maintain pressure, while mana fixing lands like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells. Overall, the key concept is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and synergistic aggro strategy centered around Human tribal creatures.

The deck is focused on controlling the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to play powerful threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Karn Liberated, as well as disruption spells like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus. The key concept of the deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying powerful threats to quickly close out the game.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with artifact creatures and using cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to pump them up and deal massive damage quickly. With Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana, and Arcbound Ravager to sacrifice artifacts for extra value, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to set up their own strategy. Karn, Scion of Urza serves as a powerful late-game finisher, while Inkmoth Nexus provides an alternate win condition through infect damage. Hope of Ghirapur disrupts the opponent's game plan while Vault Skirge offers lifelink to stabilize against aggro decks.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient and powerful Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck can quickly pump up its creatures and overwhelm opponents. Cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt opponents' plans, while Aether Vial allows for creatures to be played at instant speed. The deck also features a strong mana base with cards like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Ziggurat to ensure smooth and consistent casting of its Human creatures. The goal is to swarm the opponent and finish the game swiftly.

The key concept of this deck revolves around generating mana efficiently with cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer, casting multiple spells in a single turn to build storm count, and eventually using Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for key combo pieces, while Past in Flames allows for graveyard recursion. Card draw and selection spells like Serum Visions and Opt help to dig for necessary pieces. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent using a combination of key instant spells and powerful creatures with evasion. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Remand and Mana Leak while also dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt and Wizard's Lightning. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by recasting key spells from the graveyard, and Delver of Secrets can turn into a threatening flyer. The deck's mana base allows for consistency in casting spells and activating creature abilities.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It employs a mixture of powerful creatures like Baneslayer Angel and Huntmaster of the Fells, along with efficient mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to ramp up its threats. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Aven Mindcensor and Thalia, Heretic Cathar also helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan. This deck aims to quickly apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile.

This aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with powerful Human creatures and using disruptive cards to control the game. The key strategy is to quickly grow Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant while using Aether Vial and creature abilities to outpace the opponent. With a mix of aggressive creatures, disruptive spells like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage, and mana-fixing lands, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent offensive strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive human creatures, using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to grow their power. Cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Aether Vial allows for instant creature deployment. The mana base is optimized for consistently casting human creatures with cards like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and disruptive spells in order to secure a quick victory.

This Modern Aggro-Humans deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence by utilizing powerful Human creatures that buff each other. By playing cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures that can quickly close out the game. With cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls, the deck can also ensure its creatures hit the battlefield without being countered, giving it a strong advantage in the early game.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive Human creatures and using disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage to control the opponent's game plan. With the help of cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature-based strategy. The mana base is optimized to support the tribal theme of Humans, allowing for smooth and consistent plays. The deck excels at putting pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategies with disruptive creatures and efficient plays.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Combo - Living End deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cycling creatures like Archfiend of Ifnir, Desert Cerodon, and Street Wraith, and then cast Living End to bring them all back to the battlefield, potentially wiping out your opponent's board. By using cards like Violent Outburst and Demonic Dread to cascade into Living End, you can set up powerful combos and overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of high-powered creatures. The deck also includes disruption cards like Faerie Macabre and Beast Within to control the game and protect your combo.

The main concept of this Control - Faeries deck is to establish control of the board with counterspells and removal while utilizing the faeries' abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Delver of Secrets and Snapcaster Mage provide early threats, while Spellstutter Sprite and Vendilion Clique offer tempo plays. The deck aims to maintain a balance of threats and disruption, using versatile cards like Opt and Remand to dig for answers and protect its own creatures. Mutavault and Faerie creatures provide additional value and flexibility in combat. Overall, the deck focuses on outmaneuvering opponents and grinding out incremental advantages.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing for powerful late-game plays such as casting Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to disrupt the opponent's strategy while searching for key pieces with cards like Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings. The goal is to control the game early on and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats in the later stages, leading to victory through sheer advantage and superior board presence.
